column3: 1. Have AI enabled tools changed the level of autonomy I have in making key decisions within my role?
column4: 2. Have the boundaries of decision ownership in my team become less clear since the introduction of AI systems?
column5: 3. Have AI output artifacts influenced which decisions are escalated to higher management?
column6: 4. Does my organization have explicit criteria for determining when AI systems can make or suggest decisions autonomously?
column7: 5. Has the distribution of decision making among Engineering managers, Product Managers and Staff Engineers shifted due AI adoption in my company?
column8: 6. Have AI driven artifacts made communication easier among leadership position roles in my organization?
column9: 7. Has the use of AI generated summaries or reports improved the clarity of cross functional communication from leadership?
column10: 8. Has gen AI content reduced the need for direct human interaction among leadership members?
column11: 9. Do I trust gen AI communications to accurately represent the intent and context of the expected messages?
column12: 10. Has the frequency and format of coordination among product, engineering and leadership changed since the introduction of gen AI artifacts/tools?
column13: 11. When AI-supported decisions have led to issues, its responsibility for outcomes is clearly assigned within my organization?
column14: 12. The presence of AI systems has increased uncertainty about who is accountable for critical decisions.
column15: 13. My organization maintains transparent records explaining how AI assisted decisions are made.
column16: 14. There are formal escalation procedures when AI assisted recommendations conflict with human judgement
column17: 15. The introduction of AI decision support has strengthened overall accountability across leadership roles.
